panels.title: Welcome to Cybersecurity & Hacking Club!
panels.text: Welcome to Interlake’s Cybersecurity & Hacking Club! We meet every Monday after school from 3:30-4:30 in Room 2713. We cover the basics of computer security, learn skills, and discuss real-world applicability. Skills include decrypting, reverse engineering, exploiting websites, running scripts, and more. We also compete in Capture the Flag competitions either as a whole team or in separate individual teams based on the competition.

panels.title: Capture The Flag
panels.text: Capture-The-Flag (CTF) competitions are online-based and are filled with challenging problems related to computer security. Participants try to ‘hack’ problems. Every CTF is distinct from one another, but CTFs are usually categorized into 5 main spheres, notably: Cryptography, Forensics, Web Exploitation, Reverse Engineering, and Binary Exploitation. Challenges usually progress from 'Beginner' level to 'Advanced'. Entering CTFs helps you gain problem-solving skills, collaborative skills, and independent thinking-out-of-the-box skills.

panels.title: Lectures
panels.text: All of our lectures are done through Google Slides and can be found on google drive. If you ever miss a day or need to catch up, feel free to look here for the material that you missed.

panels.title: Our Team
